titles.ar: باب فَضْلِ الْمَسْجِدِ الْأَعْظَمِ بِالْكُوفَةِ وَ فَضْلِ الصَّلَاةِ فِيهِ وَ الْمَوَاضِعِ الْمَحْبُوبَةِ فِيهِ
titles.en: Chapter 102 – The merit of the Grand Masjid of Al-Kufa, and the merit of the Salāt performed therein, and the beloved places in it

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: حسن - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (15/485)

narrator_chain.text: عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنْ عَمْرِو بْنِ عُثْمَانَ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ عُذَافِرٍ عَنْ أَبِي حَمْزَةَ أَوْ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ مُسْلِمٍ عَنْ أَبِي جَعْفَرٍ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ

text: إِنَّ بِالْكُوفَةِ مَسَاجِدَ مَلْعُونَةً وَ مَسَاجِدَ مُبَارَكَةً فَأَمَّا الْمُبَارَكَةُ فَمَسْجِدُ غَنِيٍّ وَ اللَّهِ إِنَّ قِبْلَتَهُ لَقَاسِطَةٌ وَ إِنَّ طِينَتَهُ لَطَيِّبَةٌ وَ لَقَدْ وَضَعَهُ رَجُلٌ مُؤْمِنٌ وَ لَا تَذْهَبُ الدُّنْيَا حَتَّى تَفَجَّرَ مِنْهُ عَيْنَانِ وَ تَكُونَ عِنْدَهُ جَنَّتَانِ وَ أَهْلُهُ مَلْعُونُونَ وَ هُوَ مَسْلُوبٌ مِنْهُمْ وَ مَسْجِدُ بَنِي ظَفَرٍ وَ هُوَ مَسْجِدُ السَّهْلَةِ وَ مَسْجِدٌ بِالْخَمْرَاءِ وَ مَسْجِدُ جُعْفِيٍّ وَ لَيْسَ هُوَ الْيَوْمَ مَسْجِدَهُمْ قَالَ دَرَسَ
فَأَمَّا الْمَسَاجِدُ الْمَلْعُونَةُ فَمَسْجِدُ ثَقِيفٍ وَ مَسْجِدُ الْأَشْعَثِ وَ مَسْجِدُ جَرِيرٍ وَ مَسْجِدُ سِمَاكٍ وَ مَسْجِدٌ بِالْخَمْرَاءِ بُنِيَ عَلَى قَبْرِ فِرْعَوْنٍ مِنَ الْفَرَاعِنَةِ .

en.hubeali: Ali Bin Ibrahim, from his father, from Amro Bin Usman, from Muhammad Bin Uzafir, from Abu Hamza, or from Muhammad Bin Muslim,

(It has been narrated) from Abu Ja’far<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘In Al-Kufa there are accursed Masjids and Blessed Masjids. So, as for the Blessed, so it is Masjid Ghaniyyin. By Allah<sup>azwj</sup>! Its (direction of) Qiblah is balanced and just and as its clay (is good), and a Believing man has established (founded) it, and before the end of world two fountains will gush out from it and two gardens happen to be in its presence. However, the people around it are condemned and the Masjid is taken away from them. And the Masjid of the Clan of Zafar (is another such) Masjid, And another Masjid is in Al-Khamra’a, and Masjid Ju’fy, and it is not their Masjid today’. He<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘It is extinct’.
So, as for the accursed Masjids, so it is Masjid Saqeef, and Masjid Al-Ash’as, and Masjid Jareer, and Masjid Simak, and Masjid at Al-Khamra’a built upon a grave of a Pharaoh from the Pharohs’.
en.sarwar: 1. Ali ibn Ibrahim has narrated from his father from ‘Amr ibn ‘Uthman from Muhammad ibn ‘ Adhafir from abu Hamzah or from Muhammad ibn Muslim who has said the following: “In Kufa there are condemned Masjids and blessed Masjids. One of the blessed Masjids is the Masjid of Ghany. By Allah, the direction of Qiblah thereof is balanced and just and its soil is blessed. A believing man established it and before the end of the world, two fountains will gush forth there-from with two gardens nearby. However, the people around it are condemned and the Masjid is taken away from them. Banu Zafar’s, al-Sahlah Masjid, is another such Masjid. Another Masjid is in al-Khumrah and yet another one is Al-Ju‘fiy Masjid and today it is not their Masjid. He said, ‘It is destroyed.’ “Other condemned Masjid are Saqif, al-Ash‘ath and Jarir Masjids. There is also Sammak Masjid in al-Khumrah which is built on the grave of a pharaoh of the pharaohs.”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: مجهول - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (15/485)

parts.text: الْحَسَنِ بْنِ عَلِيِّ بْنِ عَبْدِ اللَّهِ

narrator_chain.text: مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَحْيَى عَنِ الْحَسَنِ بْنِ عَلِيِّ بْنِ عَبْدِ اللَّهِ عَنْ عُبَيْسِ بْنِ هِشَامٍ عَنْ سَالِمٍ عَنْ أَبِي جَعْفَرٍ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ

text: جُدِّدَتْ أَرْبَعَةُ مَسَاجِدَ بِالْكُوفَةِ فَرَحاً لِقَتْلِ الْحُسَيْنِ ( عليه السلام ) مَسْجِدُ الْأَشْعَثِ وَ مَسْجِدُ جَرِيرٍ وَ مَسْجِدُ سِمَاكٍ وَ مَسْجِدُ شَبَثِ بْنِ رِبْعِيٍّ .

en.hubeali: Muhammad Bin Yahya, from Al-Hassan Bin Ali Bin Abullah, from Ubeys Bin Hisham, from Salim,

(It has been narrated) from Abu Ja’far<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘Four Masjids were renewed in Al-Kufa in happiness of the killing of Al-Husayn<sup>asws</sup> – Masjid Al-Ash’as, and Masjid Jareyr, and Masjid Simak, and Masjid Shabas Bin Rabie’.
en.sarwar: 2. Muhammad ibn Yahya has narrated from al-Hassan ibn Ali ibn ‘Abd Allah from ‘Ubays ibn Hisham from Salim who has said the following: “Abu Ja’far, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, has said, ‘Four Masjids were rebuilt in Kufa to express happiness for the killing of al-Husayn, ‘Alayhi al-Salam : Al-Ash‘ath and Jarir Masjids, Sammak and Shabath ibn Rib‘i’s Masjids.”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: مرسل كالصحيح وآخره مرسل - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (5/486)

narrator_chain.text: مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَحْيَى عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ الْحُسَيْنِ عَنْ صَفْوَانَ بْنِ يَحْيَى عَنْ بَعْضِ أَصْحَابِنَا عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ

text: إِنَّ أَمِيرَ الْمُؤْمِنِينَ ( صلوات الله عليه ) نَهَى بِالْكُوفَةِ عَنِ الصَّلَاةِ فِي خَمْسَةِ مَسَاجِدَ مَسْجِدِ الْأَشْعَثِ بْنِ قَيْسٍ وَ مَسْجِدِ جَرِيرِ بْنِ عَبْدِ اللَّهِ الْبَجَلِيِّ وَ مَسْجِدِ سِمَاكِ بْنِ مَخْرَمَةَ وَ مَسْجِدِ شَبَثِ بْنِ رِبْعِيٍّ وَ مَسْجِدِ التَّيْمِ .
وَ فِي رِوَايَةِ أَبِي بَصِيرٍ مَسْجِدِ بَنِي السِّيدِ وَ مَسْجِدِ بَنِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ بْنِ دَارِمٍ وَ مَسْجِدِ غَنِيٍّ وَ مَسْجِدِ سِمَاكٍ وَ مَسْجِدِ ثَقِيفٍ وَ مَسْجِدِ الْأَشْعَثِ .

en.hubeali: Muhammad Bin Yahya, from Muhammad Bin Al-Husayn, from Safwan Bin Yahya, from one of our companions,

(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullahasws having said: ‘Amir Al-Momineenasws forbade in Al-Kufa from performing Salāt in five Masjids – Masjid Al-Ash’as Bin Qays, and Masjid Jareyr Bin Abdullah Bin Al-Bajal, and Masjid Simak Bin Makhrama, and Masjid Shabas Bin Rabie, and Masjid Al-Taym’.
And in a report of Abu Baseer, ‘Masjid of Clan of Sayyid, and Masjid of the Clan of Abdullah Bin Darim, and Masjid Ghaniyyin, and Masjid Simak, and Masjid Saqeef, and Masjid Al-Ash’as’.
en.sarwar: 3. Muhammad ibn Yahya has narrated from al-Husayn ibn Safwan ibn Yahya from certain individuals of our people who has said the following: “Abu ‘Abd Allah, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, has said that ’Amir al-Mu’minin, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, prohibited performing Salah (prayer) in five Masjids in Kufah, such as al-Ash‘ath ibn Qays’ Masjid, Jarir ibn ‘Abd Allah al-Bajaliy’s Masjid, Sammak ibn Makhruma’s Masjid, Shabath ibn Rib‘i’s Masjid and al-Taym’s Masjid.” According to a Hadith from abu Basir, one such Masjid is banu al-Sayyid Masjid, banu ‘Abd Allah ibn Darime Masjid, Ghany Masjid, Sammak’ Masjid, Thaqif’s Masjid and al-Ash‘ath’s Masjid.”
